briefdescription.para: List of rigidbodies associated with player-controlled objects. These are recorded at a higher frequency for better precision.
List of regular rigidbodies in the scene that are not player-controlled. These are recorded at a lower frequency to optimize performance.
Scroll position for the main window content.
Scroll position for the saved sessions list.
Currently selected rigidbody for detailed information display.
Name to be used when saving the current recording session.
Reference to the ReplayRecorder instance that manages recording.
Currently selected replay session for playback.
Reference to the ReplayPlayer instance that manages playback.
Playback speed multiplier (1.0 = normal speed).
Whether to show the replay control UI elements.
Creates and shows the Replay Tools window.
Called when the window is enabled. Initializes the window by refreshing rigidbody lists, subscribing to editor events, and initializing the replay player.
Called when the window is disabled. Unsubscribes from editor events and stops any active playback.
Called when the window is destroyed. Performs final cleanup of the replay player instance.
Handles state changes between edit mode and play mode. Initializes the recorder when entering play mode and cleans up when exiting.
Called during regular editor updates. Used to repaint the window during replay playback to show updated playback progress.
Refreshes the lists of player and non-player rigidbodies in the scene. Rigidbodies with a PlayerInput component are classified as player rigidbodies.
Main GUI method that draws the entire window content. Organizes the window into distinct functional sections.
Draws the recording controls section of the window. Includes recording start/stop buttons, recording status, and save controls.
Draws the saved sessions section of the window. Displays a list of all saved replay sessions with options to select, delete, or clear all.
Draws the replay controls section of the window. Provides playback controls for the selected replay session including play/pause, stop, and playback speed adjustment.
Draws the lists of player and normal rigidbodies detected in the scene. Allows selection of individual rigidbodies for detailed information.
Draws detailed information about the currently selected rigidbody. Shows properties like name, type, mass, position, and velocity (in play mode).
Draws a single rigidbody item in the list with selection toggle and basic information.

parameterdescription.para: Whether this is a player-controlled rigidbody

briefdescription.para: Called every frame during editor updates. Repaints the window when necessary to reflect current recording or playback status.
Custom Unity Editor window for managing gameplay recordings and replays. Provides functionality to record, save, and replay physics-based gameplay with support for both player and non-player objects.
